snippet: The program, announced by survivors and families, aims to help colleges and universities ask the hard questions about how they handle campus hazards.
abstract: Virginia Tech Victims Family Outreach Foundation unveils 32 National Campus Safety Initiative; program consists of nine surveys meant to be used by colleges and universities to evaluate how they can be made safer and whether they are prepared for campus shootings like one at Virginia Tech in 2007.
lead_paragraph: The program, announced by survivors and families, aims to help colleges and universities ask the hard questions about how they handle campus hazards.

headline.main: Families of Virginia Tech Massacre Victims Start Program to Improve Campus Safety
headline.print_headline: Campus Safety Program Set Up in Victims’ Memory

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
